column6: 0.91” OLED display with SSD1306 I2C board
6mm square * 4.3mm tall THT SPST momentary tactile switch
DPST off-on pushbutton switch. PB400EEQR1BLK comes with a round black cap,  PB400EEQX is the same thing without the cap (the round cap can be discarded)
Schmitt Trigger Output Optocoupler, High Speed, DIP-6, 1.6mA turn on threshold

column5: CUI Devices SD-50SN, but I’ve also seen these sold generically.
AKA “DuPont” connectors, preferably joined in a ribbon, to be separated into 6-, 4-, and 2-wire ribbons
5-15mm length is fine, M2.5 bolts and nuts will also work here.
NOT pre-mounted onto a PCB. 12mm shaft height, 6mm shaft diameter
eg. 3M Bumpon SJ-5508, but anything will work
Raspberry Pi 3A or 3B works with rev 1.1+ rear PCB
This uses the standard MIDI DIN connector, see below for the USB variant
Helps align the OLED on the front PCB, see README for fitting notes
Uses a Sparkfun Pro Micro (Arduino) board to provide USB MIDI input to the synth
See MIDIUARTUSB/README.md for notes and Arduino sketch
Clone boards are usually okay as long as the microcontroller is genuine.

column3: small strip of double-sided adhesive tape
column5: To stick the Pro Micro board to the base. Thickness doesn’t matter as there’s plenty of clearance.
For 5v version of Sparkfun Pro Micro board
Only if using the 3.3v version of the Sparkfun Pro Micro board

Still looks like a 10-button faceplate, but 8 of the buttons are hard-printed onto the face (not clickable)
